00040 #ifndef _node_h
00041 #define _node_h
00042 
00043 #include "attachable.h"
00044 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00045 #include "datatypes.h"
00046 #include "vector3.h"
00047 #include "quaternion.h"
00048 
00049 namespace Ogre
00050 {
00051     class SceneNode;
00052 }
00053 
00054 namespace phys
00055 {
00056     class SceneManager;
00057     class Camera;
00058     class Light;
00059     class ParticleEffect;
00060     class ActorBase;
00061     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00062     /// @class Node
00063     /// @headerfile node.h
00064     /// @brief This is a helper class which non-physics objects, such as lights, cameras, ribbon trails, and
00065     /// particle effects may be attached to for enhanced effects.
00066     /// @details This class simply contains a group of functions for easy manipulation of movement and orientation
00067     /// as well as attaching elements to them.  This class should only be created through the scene manager. @n
00068     /// There are 4 types of nodes: @n
00069     /// Center - Works in conjunction with the orbit node and serves as it's center point for the orbit node to
00070     /// rotate around. @n
00071     /// Orbit - Counterpart to the Center node, this type does the orbiting. @n
00072     /// Stand - Stationary node that points in one direction, that is it. @n
00073     /// Free - A node with no rules governing how it moves. @n
00074     /// Note:  There are no rules restricting the use of nodes anyway, this enum is here simply to help
00075     /// indicate the intended use upon creation.
00076     ///////////////////////////////////////
00077     class PHYS_LIB Node
00078     {
00079         public:
00080             enum NodeType
00081             {
00082                 Center,
00083                 Orbit,
00084                 Stand,
00085                 Free
00086             };
00087         protected:
00088             /// @brief Pointer to the ogre scenenode from which this class gets it's functionality.
00089             Ogre::SceneNode* OgreNode;
00090             /// @brief Pointer to the manager that created this class.
00091             SceneManager* Manager;
00092             /// @brief Enum value storing the type of node this class is.
00093             Node::NodeType Type;
00094             /// @brief Vector storing all attached cameras.
00095             std::vector< Attachable* > Elements;
00096         public:
00097             /// @brief Standard initialization constructor.
00098             /// @param Name The name of this node.
00099             /// @param manager Pointer to the manager that this node is to be used in.
00100             Node(const String& Name, SceneManager* manager);
00101             /// @brief Internal constructor.
00102             /// @details This constructor should not be called on manually.
00103             /// @param snode Pointer to the Ogre SceneNode this class is based on.
00104             /// @param manager Pointer to the manager that this node is to be used in.
00105             Node(Ogre::SceneNode* snode, SceneManager* manager);
00106             /// @brief Class destructor.
00107             ~Node();
00108             /// @brief Gets the name of this node.
00109             /// @return Returns a string containing the name given to this node.
00110             ConstString& GetName();
00111             /// @brief Attaches an attachable element to this Node.
00112             /// @param Element The Element to be attached.
00113             void AttachElement(Attachable* Element);
00114             /// @brief Detaches an attachable element from this Node.
00115             /// @param Element The Element to be detached.
00116             void DetachElement(Attachable* Element);
00117             /// @brief Detaches all attached cameras, lights, and particle effects.
00118             void DetachAllElements();
00119             /// @brief Gets the number of elements attached to this node.
00120             /// @return Returns the number of elements attached to this node.
00121             Whole GetNumAttachedElements();
00122             /// @brief Sets the position of this node.
00123             /// @param Position A vector3 representing the location of this node.
00124             void SetPosition(Vector3 Position);
00125             /// @brief Gets the position of this node.
00126             /// @return Returns a vector3 representing the location of this node.
00127             Vector3 GetPosition();
00128             /// @brief Sets the orientation of this node.
00129             /// @param Position A Quaternion representing the orientation of this node.
00130             void SetOrientation(Quaternion Orientation);
00131             /// @brief Gets the orientation of this node.
00132             /// @return Returns a quaternion representing the orientation of this node.
00133             Quaternion GetOrientation();
00134             /// @brief Automatically sets the orientation needed to point this node at a location in the world.
00135             /// @param LookAt The location in world space to point at.
00136             void LookAt(Vector3 LookAt);
00137             /// @brief Makes this node autotrack another node.
00138             /// @details This function will make this node update it's orientation every frame automatically so
00139             /// that it's always facing the target node.
00140             /// @param node The node to be tracked.
00141             /// @param Offset A vector3 representing the offset from the nodes location to be tracked.
00142             void SetAutoTracking(Node* node, Vector3 Offset=Vector3());
00143             /// @brief Makes this node autotrack an actor.
00144             /// @details This function will make this node update it's orientation every frame automatically so
00145             /// that it's always facing the target actor.
00146             /// @param Actor The actor to be tracked.
00147             /// @param Offset A vector3 representing the offset from the actor's location to be tracked.
00148             void SetAutoTracking(ActorBase* Actor, Vector3 Offset=Vector3());
00149             /// @brief Disables any active autotracking for this node.
00150             void DisableAutoTracking();
00151             /// @brief Increments the orbit of this node if this is an orbiting node.
00152             /// @details This function has no effect if this isn't an orbiting node.
00153             /// @param Radians A real reprsenting the amount of orbit to increment in radians.
00154             void IncrementOrbit(Real Radians);
00155             /// @brief Sets the type of node that this is.
00156             /// @details This is intended for internal/expert use only.  Manually calling this could disrupt normal function.
00157             /// @param type The type of node this is to be set as.
00158             void SetType(Node::NodeType type);
00159             /// @brief Gets the type of node that this is.
00160             /// @return Returns the type of node this is set as.
00161             Node::NodeType GetType();
00162     };//node
00163 }//phys
00164 
00165 #endif
Generated on Tue Jan 25 23:24:46 2011 for PhysGameEngine by  1.6.3
